version_description: We've made some bug fixes for the iPad and our check deposit feature.
We've made some bug fixes for the iPad and our check deposit feature.
We've made some bug fixes for the iPad and our check deposit feature.
We've made some bug fixes for the iPad and our check deposit feature.
We've made some bug fixes for the iPad and our check deposit feature.

To the many members who’ve already given feedback on the new app, thanks so much! You’re helping us make it better. Here are the latest improvements:

•Freeze/Unfreeze lets you temporarily lock (and later unlock) your own credit card without having to contact us. Think you just misplaced it? Freeze it ‘til you find it!
•Balance Transfer makes it a snap to bring external credit card balances over to your Affinity Plus credit card.

We also made several bug fixes:

•iPad’s screen orientation is no longer locked in portrait
•App no longer crashes when orientation rotates quickly
•Bill Pay issues were resolved
•Mobile Check Deposit no longer has issues specific to iPad 2
•Lots of other little miscellaneous kinks were worked out, too

We’ll continue enhancing the app with features you ask for, so please keep asking! You can do that either in a review, or by sending feedback right from the app’s More screen.

To the many members who’ve already given feedback on the new app, thanks so much! You’re helping us make it better. Here are the latest improvements:

•Other Members’ Accounts: Now you can add them right in the app for easy transfers!
•We also made minor fixes related to how Transfer and Bill Pay info displays.

We’ll continue enhancing the app with features you ask for, so please keep asking! You can do that either in a review, or by sending feedback right from the app’s More screen.

Thanks for your patience the past few days! During the downtime, we made major improvements to our internal systems. Now we’re back up and even better!

And if you didn’t notice we were down, great! But you probably will notice a few things in this latest release:

•You can edit your account nicknames
•iPad Multitasking (split screen for 2 apps at once) is available
•Some of your numbers have different labels now: Share ID/Loan ID is for internal transfers, and Account Number (MICR) is for external transfers, direct deposits and paying bills
•There’s some more clarity about Regulation D (a monthly limit for withdrawing and transferring from each savings account – a federal regulation)

We’ll continue enhancing the app with features you ask for, so please keep asking! You can do that either in a review, or by sending feedback right from the app’s More screen. Thank you!

We keep adding features you ask for, so please keep asking! Your detailed feedback in App Store reviews and elsewhere helps us make the app better, so thank you. Speaking of making it better, here’s what’s new in 2.2:

•Better Bill Pay! Now you can enroll in Bill Pay from the app, and see your eBill amounts and due dates. All the important info’s right there.
•We also made several bug fixes.

We keep adding features you ask for, so please keep asking! Here’s what’s new in 2.3:

• Digital Statements & Notices are in the app! Now you’ll have access from anywhere to your banking and credit card statements PLUS you’ll save trees. And get fewer papercuts. View your digital Statements & Notices (or enroll if you haven’t already) from the More screen.
• Mortgage payment details now show more important info like escrow and additional principal.
• We also made several bug fixes.

We keep adding features you ask for, so please keep asking! Here’s what’s new in 2.4:

• The app is now more accessible for blind, partially sighted, and other members who use screen reader technology. Functionality was simplified, and helpful directional language was added to make logging in, scrolling through account lists, checking transactions, and scheduling transfers easier for everyone.

We keep adding features you ask for, so please keep asking! Here’s what’s new in 2.6:

• Your total MyPlus Rewards™ points now appear on your Accounts screen, so you always know exactly what you have!
• We also added helpful info about how you earn points and what you can get with them, so you know more about your options upfront.

You can also now rename your transactions (in non–credit card accounts) to whatever makes more sense to you, so it’s easier to keep track of your money.

We made the following fixes in the 2.7.2 release:

• The button to add an External Account is now visible, no matter the screen size.
• External Accounts' account type and bank name now appear correctly.
• On devices running iOS 13, these features now work properly after you completely exit the app: Touch ID, Remember my User ID, and the login page's background image.

Bug Fixes

• Security Upgrade: You’ll be prompted to verify your identity the first time you log in after the upgrade, and also the first time you log in from a different location and/or different device.

• Video Calls to Member Advisors: You can now access the separate Video Banking Mobile App from this app’s Contact screen, and get face-to-face help from anywhere.

• Mortgage Transaction Details now shore more info, including Additional Principal.

The 3.4 release is all about bug fixes:
• Bill Pay: Pending and scheduled payments now show up on the History tab and on the Payees list; and the Payee Search function works as it should.
• ATM & Branch Finder now works as it should.
• Credit Card Statements now load (for members who’ve selected digital delivery vs. paper).
• Card Controls & Alerts: The International Purchases control works again.

Here’s what’s new in the 3.5 release:

• An intermittent Mobile Check Deposit bug has been fixed. It took us a while to figure this one out, and we know it inconvenienced many of our members. If you were affected, please accept our apology, and also our thanks for your patience!
• Also, if you have an Affinity Plus credit card with other authorized users, you’ll now see separate cards listed under Manage Cards.
• This means you can set up different Card Controls & Alerts for each one!
• Set a transaction limit for one card, but not the other. Or temporarily freeze one if you ever misplace it, and keep using the other in the meantime.

Here’s what’s new in the 3.5 release:

• An intermittent Mobile Check Deposit bug has been fixed. It took us a while to figure this one out, and we know it inconvenienced many of our members. If you were affected, please accept our apology, and also our thanks for your patience!
• Also, if you have an Affinity Plus credit card with other authorized users, you’ll now see separate cards listed under Manage Cards.
• This means you can set up different Card Controls & Alerts for each one!
• Set a transaction limit for one card, but not the other. Or temporarily freeze one if you ever misplace it, and keep using the other in the meantime.

Here’s what’s new in the 3.5 release:

• An intermittent Mobile Check Deposit bug has been fixed. It took us a while to figure this one out, and we know it inconvenienced many of our members. If you were affected, please accept our apology, and also our thanks for your patience!
• Also, if you have an Affinity Plus credit card with other authorized users, you’ll now see separate cards listed under Manage Cards.
• This means you can set up different Card Controls & Alerts for each one!
• Set a transaction limit for one card, but not the other. Or temporarily freeze one if you ever misplace it, and keep using the other in the meantime.

Here’s what’s new in the 3.5 release:

• An intermittent Mobile Check Deposit bug has been fixed. It took us a while to figure this one out, and we know it inconvenienced many of our members. If you were affected, please accept our apology, and also our thanks for your patience!
• Also, if you have an Affinity Plus credit card with other authorized users, you’ll now see separate cards listed under Manage Cards.
• This means you can set up different Card Controls & Alerts for each one!
• Set a transaction limit for one card, but not the other. Or temporarily freeze one if you ever misplace it, and keep using the other in the meantime.

Here’s what’s new in the 3.5 release:

• An intermittent Mobile Check Deposit bug has been fixed. It took us a while to figure this one out, and we know it inconvenienced many of our members. If you were affected, please accept our apology, and also our thanks for your patience!
• Also, if you have an Affinity Plus credit card with other authorized users, you’ll now see separate cards listed under Manage Cards.
• This means you can set up different Card Controls & Alerts for each one!
• Set a transaction limit for one card, but not the other. Or temporarily freeze one if you ever misplace it, and keep using the other in the meantime.

• Have multiple memberships? The new Quick Switch shortcut makes it easier to access all your Affinity Plus accounts. After logging in, just tap your profile picture, and follow the prompts.
• There’s also new Account Alerts to help you keep closer track of your checking, savings, and loans. Get reminders about upcoming due-dates, confirmations when your paychecks post, notifications about your available balance, and more. You’ll find Account Alerts on the More screen.
